Package mmj.util

Class OutputBoss

java.lang.Object
mmj.util.Boss
mmj.util.OutputBoss
public class OutputBoss extends Boss
Responsible for managing and using Messages, Dump and writing to sysOut/sysErr.

OutputBoss' main responsibility is directing output to the user-designated destination, so it provides its own "print-and-clear-messages" function for the other Boss classes to use.

A key point to note is that in BatchMMJ2, Messages are printed and cleared immediately after being generated, they are not accumulated for some later purpose. Therefore, OutputBoss uses messages.reallocateInfoMessages and messages.reallocateErrorMessages when a MaxErrorMessages or MaxInfoMessages runparm is changed. It also uses LangConstants.MAX_ERROR_MESSAGES_DEFAULT and LangConstants.MAX_INFO_MESSAGES_DEFAULT if the relevant runParms are *not* input.

  • Method Details

    • printAndClearMessages

      public void printAndClearMessages()
      Print all error/info messages, then clear the messages from the Messages repository.

      Note: startup errors are gathered and displayed here via calls to methods in MMJ2FailPopupWindow. The gathering and displaying are separate because when the popup window is shown the error messages should already be displayed on the Command Prompt window -- but that process clears the messages from the Messages object. So the messages are accumulated by MMJ2FailPopupWindow before being displayed on the Command Prompt window...

    • printException

      public void printException(Throwable t) throws IOException
      Print an exception to the console. Will extract an MMJException cause if one exists, otherwise it will print a full stack trace. Prints nothing if the verbosity is too low or the error code has been disabled.
      Parameters:
      t - line to print.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurred

    • checkBookManagerReady

      protected BookManager checkBookManagerReady(LogicalSystem logicalSystem)
      Checks to see if BookManager is initialized and enabled.

      Caution: throws IllegalArgumentException if BookManager is not enabled! Ouch.

      Parameters:
      logicalSystem - the LogicalSystem in use.
      Returns:
      BookManager object in enabled status.

    • editBookManagerSectionNbr

      protected Section editBookManagerSectionNbr(int valueFieldNbr, BookManager bookManager)
      Checks to see if BookManager is initialized and enabled.

      Caution: throws IllegalArgumentException if Section Number is not a positive integer, or if it is not found within the BookManager! Ouch.

      Parameters:
      valueFieldNbr - number of value field within RunParm.
      bookManager - the BookManager to check
      Returns:
      Section BookManager section.
